content.title: Scheme Of Financial Assistance For The Preservation And Development Of Cultural Heritage Of The Himalayas
content.state: UT of Jammu & Kashmir, UT of Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, Uttrakhand, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh
content.details: The scheme was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India, to promote, protect and preserve the cultural heritage of the Himalayan region through research, documentation, dissemination, etc.
benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹10.00 lakhs to any single organization for various cultural heritage projects.
eligibility: Registered as a society under the Societies Registration Act 1860 or as a public trust under Indian Trust Act, 1882.
Functioning for a period of three years.
Colleges and Universities are also eligible to apply.
Capacity to undertake and promote research projects.
exclusions: Organizations that are in receipt of grants from any other source for similar purposes.
content.application_process: Offline application process through the Ministry of Culture with prescribed format and necessary documents.
documents_required: Copy of the valid Registration Certificate.
Copies of Audited Accounts for the last three years.
Copies of the Annual Report for the last three years.
Write-up on the activity to be undertaken.
Brief profile of the research personnel.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To promote, protect and preserve the cultural heritage of the Himalayan region.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Is this scheme centrally sponsored?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is centrally sponsored.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Up to a maximum of ₹10.00 lakhs to any single organization.

faqs.question: Which type of organization is eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Voluntary organizations registered under the Societies Registration Act 1860 or as a public trust.
